title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Unable to open file in another editor if already opened in one editor (missing error message)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Unable to open file in another editor if already opened in one editor (missing error message)
OB: When a file is already opened in one editor, the user tries to open the same file in another editor by right clicking on the file and selecting 'Open With' followed by 'System Editor'. However, nothing happens and there is no warning or error message displayed in the workbench.
EB: When a file is already opened in one editor, if the user tries to open the same file in another editor by right clicking on the file and selecting 'Open With' followed by 'System Editor', a warning message should be displayed in the workbench. The warning message should inform the user that they may overwrite changes and ask if they want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed, stating that all files need to be closed first before opening the file in another editor. This is a safety feature to prevent external editing while the file is already opened in the workspace.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right click on the Java file.
3. Select 'Open With' followed by 'System Editor'.
4. Observe that nothing happens and no warning or error message is displayed in the workbench.
